People: Francisco Madero, Emiliano Zapata, Venustiano Carranza
Desc: Political upheaval and revolt against the Porfirio Díaz dictatorship
Causes: Growing inequality and poverty in Mexico, Díaz’s repression of opposition
Consequences: Mexico becomes a constitutional republic; Zapata’s demands for agrarian reform lead to the fall of Carranza
Opposing Sides: Liberals led by Madero; Zapatistas; the Constitutionalist forces of Carranza
Outcome: Victory for the rebels; overthrow of the dictatorship; Mexico becomes a democracy
Significance: Mexico finds more stability in her government, recognizes the right of suffrage, and enshrines popular sovereignty
